snippet: A crash in Japan last weekend left the French driver Jules Bianchi comatose, and at a news conference Thursday some drivers preparing for the first Russian Grand Prix on Sunday described a shadow over the sport.
abstract: Despite all the innovations in automobile racing that have made it possible for drivers to walk away from 180-mile-an-hour somersaults into crash barriers, there has always been the fear that the specter of death might return; Russian Grand Prix, held in Japan, is marred by crash that leaves French driver Jules Bianchi with severe brain injuries, causing fellow drivers to feel shadow has been cast over sport.
lead_paragraph: A crash in Japan last weekend left the French driver Jules Bianchi comatose, and at a news conference Thursday some drivers preparing for the first Russian Grand Prix on Sunday described a shadow over the sport.

headline.main: Formula One Debates Risks After Serious Injury to Jules Bianchi
headline.print_headline: Formula One Debates Risks After a Driver Is Badly Hurt
